Issues.Title: fix(core): fixed function overloading with createSignalFromFunction that didn't have a matching implementation
Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: perf(platform-browser): do not remove renderer from cache when `REMOVE_STYLES_ON_COMPONENT_DESTROY` is enabled.
Issues.Body:
Removing the renderer from cache is not needed when `REMOVE_STYLES_ON_COMPONENT_DESTROY` is enabled. This change retains the behaviour of keeping the renderer cached for the entire lifecycle of the application the same way it is done when `REMOVE_STYLES_ON_COMPONENT_DESTROY` is disabled.

This seems to have be causing an increase in scripting. See: http://b/290666638
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(platform-browser): do not remove renderer from cache when `REMOVE_STYLES_ON_COMPONENT_DESTROY` is enabled." (#51005)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): add internal compiler option to control NgModule selector scope emit
Issues.Body: An internal compiler option named `supportJitMode` is now available for use by the Angular CLI. This option currently controls the emit of NgModule selector scope information. This emitted information is only needed in AOT mode when an application also uses JIT. However, AOT mode combined with JIT mode is not currently supported nor will work in the Angular CLI. With the Angular CLI, JIT mode is only supported if the entire application is built in JIT mode. Without this option, the CLI needs to manually perform a code transform to remove the information and also replicate TypeScript's import eliding. This is can be a complicated operation and must be continually kept up to date with any changes to both the Angular compiler and TypeScript. The introduction of this new option alleviates these concerns while also removing several build time actions that would otherwise need to be performed on every application build.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): add internal compiler option to control NgModule selector scope emit" (#51007)

Issues.Title: Pattern validator does not use Unicode mode when pattern is of type string
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

If the specified pattern is of type string, the pattern validator does not conform to [the HTML input specifications for the pattern attribute](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/input.html#the-pattern-attribute) and therefore does not support Unicode properties.

In particular, the specification states that
> If specified, the attribute's value must match the JavaScript [Pattern](https://tc39.es/ecma262/#prod-Pattern)[+UnicodeSetsMode, +N] production.

and

> Let anchoredPattern be the string "^(?:", followed by pattern, followed by ")$".

Especially the first one is important to use the Unicode properties.

A valid example for use in HTML would be  `[\p{L}\p{N}\-\.\(\) ]{2,}`.

In order to fix this issue, this
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1bf99e2f9265ce5c289763c5150c3ba4264fd7aa/packages/forms/src/validators.ts#L538-L546
could be replaced by

```ts
regexStr = pattern;
regex = new RegExp(`^(?:${ pattern })$`, 'u');
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

_No response_

Issues.Title: Error in tests when updating zone.js
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

zone.js

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Hello,

I have recently upgraded the zone.js package to version **0.13.1** of my Angular application and several tests that worked with version **0.13** are now throwing this error.

```
Cannot redefine property: isPlatformBrowser
at Function.defineProperty (<anonymous<)
jest.spyOn(fromNgCommon, 'isPlatformBrowser').mockReturnValue(false);
^
```

The test is implemented like this:

```
import * as fromNgCommon from '@angular/common';
jest.spyOn(fromNgCommon, 'isPlatformBrowser').mockReturnValue(false);
```

If we revert the version, the tests work correctly again.



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular 16.1.3
Node 18.12.1
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: all our unit test don't run anymore after upgrade from 15.2 to 16.1 of angular (NG0402)
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15.2.9

### Description

suddenly i get this:

```
 Error: NG0402: A required Injectable was not found in the dependency injection tree. If you are bootstrapping an NgModule, make sure that the `BrowserModule` is imported.
        error properties: Object({ code: 402 })
            at Object.useFactory (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:27584:27)
            at Object.factory (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:9383:38)
            at R3Injector.hydrate (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:9290:35)
            at R3Injector.get (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:9178:33)
            at injectInjectorOnly (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:651:33)
            at ɵɵinject (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:655:60)
            at injectArgs (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:783:23)
            at Object.factory (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:9270:45)
            at R3Injector.hydrate (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:9290:35)
            at R3Injector.get (projects/servoy-public/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:9178:33)
```

i tried to do that BrowserModule import but that didn't help
The message is just not really helpfull if it was something like
Tried to get to inject Constructor from class A with params B and C and trying to create C but that fails. then i did know where the start looking.

the test that fails is i think quite simple and doesn't need a lot of injection:

https://github.com/Servoy/servoy-eclipse/blob/master/com.servoy.eclipse.ngclient.ui/node/projects/servoy-public/src/lib/directives/decimalkeyconverter.directive.spec.ts#L32

if  i comment out this line:
 fixture = TestBed.createComponent(TestDecimalKeyConverterComponent);

then the test runs (and i get just errors that the fixture is not there)

 but if i leave that in i get the above errors..
the only real injection that component needs is:

https://github.com/Servoy/servoy-eclipse/blob/master/com.servoy.eclipse.ngclient.ui/node/projects/servoy-public/src/lib/directives/decimalkeyconverter.directive.ts#L14

so that is the elementRef and our service which i provide as a value:

https://github.com/Servoy/servoy-eclipse/blob/master/com.servoy.eclipse.ngclient.ui/node/projects/servoy-public/src/lib/directives/decimalkeyconverter.directive.spec.ts#L29

i can't find in the release notes or the upgrade path from 15 to 16 what i should change, and from the error message i also don't know what todo (i tried to import BrowserModule in that configureTestBed or just in that ServoyPublicTestingModule which it then imports and exports that all doesn't help

see the above git urls.
I can try to make a sample by itself if needed.

Issues.Title: perf(platform-browser): use `WeakRef` to perform renderer cleanup
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, we removed the renders from the cache once there were more usages. This in some cases caused an increase in scripting example when removing a component and immediately re-creating it. This uses `WeakRef` to avoid this.

Related to: http://b/290666638
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(platform-browser): use `WeakRef` to perform renderer cleanup" (#50995)

<details>
<summary>mrmlnc/fast-glob (fast-glob)</summary>

### [`v3.3.0`](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/releases/tag/3.3.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/compare/3.2.12...3.3.0)

> **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/compare/3.2.12...3.3.0

##### 🚀 Improvements

**Method aliases**

New methods (`glob`, `globSync`, `globStream`) have been added in addition to the current methods (default import, `sync`, `stream`), which eliminate the need to rename the method when importing. In addition, an `async` alias has been added for the default import, which makes it possible to use this packet with ESM.

**Method to convert paths to globs**

A new method (`convertPathToPattern`) has been added in this release to convert a path to a pattern. The primary goal is to enable users to avoid processing Windows paths in each location where this package is used by utilities from third-party packages.

See more details in the [pull request](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/392).

##### 🐛 Bug fixes

-   In the past, we mishandled patterns that contained slashes when the `baseNameMatch` option was enabled, which went against the documented behavior. ([#​312](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/312))
-   Several problems with matching patterns that contain brace expansion have been resolved.  The primary issue solved is when the pattern has duplicate slashes after it is expanded ([#​394](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/394)), or the `micromatch` package does not correctly generate a regular expression ([#​365](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/365)).
-   All negative patterns will now have the `dot` option enabled when matching paths. Previously, the `!**/*` patterns did not exclude hidden files (start with a dot). ([#​343](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/343))
-   The issue that led to duplicates in the results when overlapping or duplicate patterns were present among the patterns has been fixed. At the moment, we are only talking about leading dot. Other cases are not included. For example, running with the patterns `['./file.md', 'file.md', '*']` will now only include `file.md` once in the results. ([#​190](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/190))

##### 📖 Documentation

A [clarifying note](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/blob/master/README.md#concurrency) has been added for the `concurrency` option, which provides more detailed information about the Thread Pool utilization.

##### ⚙️ Infrastructure

-   The benchmark in CI is now running on Node.js 20.
-   The benchmark now uses the public package [bencho](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/bencho) instead of an in-house implementation. You may want to try this solution for your packages and provide feedback.

##### 🥇 New Contributors

-   [@​josh-hemphill](https://togithub.com/josh-hemphill) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/383](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/383)
-   [@​mairaw](https://togithub.com/mairaw) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/401](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/401)

</details>

Issues.Title: Strange behavior of FormGroup in custom control
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I created my own custom control, which slightly changes the behavior of DatePicker from Angular material.
Inside the custom component, I use FormGroup to store the Start and End controls.
The main problem arose in the writeValue method.
Inside this method there is a code that sets a new state for the internal form and when calling patchValue with emitEvent: false parameter. But it doesn't work as expected.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-lsrf8q

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Steps to reproduce:

1. Select any date in Datepicker
2. Click the Set custom date range button

I expect that when clicking on the button in the console, only one line '#-write_value' will be output.
In addition to the string '#-write_value', the string '#-selected_date' is also output, which is very strange, because I set the flag emitEvent: false
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.2.8
Node: 16.13.0
Package Manager: npm 8.1.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.2.9
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, material, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.8
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.8
@angular-devkit/core            15.2.8
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.8
@angular/cli                    15.2.8
@schematics/angular             15.2.8
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.9.5
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Use of input transformation is not considered in Angular language service
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Hi ! If you use `transform` on an `@Input` and having Angular Language Service enabled on VSCode you get an error from the template telling that string cannot be affected to the desired type (boolean for instance). In fact, it only work if you mark your input as potential `String` but it may be not wanted. ```ts @Component({ selector: 'app-child', standalone: true, imports: [CommonModule], template: `
{{ disabled | json }}
`, }) export class ChildComponent { @Input({ transform: booleanAttribute }) disabled = false; } @Component({ selector: 'app-host', standalone: true, imports: [ChildComponent], template: ``, // <--- Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'boolean'.ngtsc(2322) }) export class HostComponent {} ``` You will not get any error on the provided Stackblitz as it doesn't use ALS. You have to download the project and open it on VSCode. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-u5b5z4?file=src%2Fmain.ts ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'boolean'.ngtsc(2322) ``` ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 16.1.4 Node: 18.16.0 Package Manager: npm 9.7.2 OS: win32 x64 Angular: 16.1.4 ... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core ... elements, forms, material, material-date-fns-adapter ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1601.4 @angular-devkit/build-angular 16.1.4 @angular-devkit/core 16.1.4 @angular-devkit/schematics 16.1.4 @schematics/angular 16.1.4 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 5.1.6 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: Is zone-patch-rxjs still needed
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

Before angular 15, there was a `polyfill.ts` file that was generated. 
Now the polyfills are defined in `angular.json`, and it only include `zone.js`` 

If I remember correctly `zone-patch-rxjs` was imported in the old `polyfill` file. Is is not needed anymore ? 

Thanks for the clarification

Issues.Title: Caniuse-lite uses CC-by-4.0 licensing
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.3.2

### Description

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add support for serving SSR with dev-server when using the application builder
Issues.Body: This commit introduces experimental support for serving the application in SSR mode with the Vite based dev-server when using the application builder.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add support for serving SSR with dev-server when using the application builder" (#25517)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ensure TS resolution cache with file replacements
Issues.Body: When overriding module resolution on a TypeScript Host object, TypeScript will not automatically create a resolution cache for the Host. Within the application build system the TypeScript resolution is only overrided if file replacements are used. A resolution cache is now manually created and added to the TypeScript Host when file replacements are present.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ensure TS resolution cache with file replacements" (#25520)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: update angular" (#25521)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add `ssr` option in application builder
Issues.Body:
This commit adds an `ssr` option to the application builder, this can be either a `boolean` or an `object` with an `entryPoint` property.

In the future, server bundles will only be emitted when the ssr option is truthy, as unlike SSR, SSG and AppShell do not require the server bundles to be written to disk.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR " feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add `ssr` option in application builder" (#25499)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): only load browserslist in babel preset if needed
Issues.Body: The `browserslist` package is only needed in the custom Babel application preset if the `supportedBrowsers` option is specified. This option is not used within the esbuild-based browser application builder. The `browserslist` is now lazily imported only when needed and avoids the overhead of loading browser support data when not needed by the build.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): only load browserslist in babel preset if needed" (#25519)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): filter postcss usage based on content in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, stylesheets that do not need any postcss processing will now skip the postcss step of the stylesheet build pipeline. Currently, only Tailwind CSS leverages postcss and Tailwind CSS is an opt-in feature. As a result, postcss will only be used if Tailwind CSS is configured for the project and a stylesheet contains one or more of the directives/functions specific to Tailwind as provided by https://tailwindcss.com/docs/functions-and-directives. This change should be most beneficial for component stylesheets which will rarely contain Tailwind specific rules that need additional processing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): filter postcss usage based on content in esbuild builder" (#25518)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): Set chunk names explicitly
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?

<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Currently, chunk names are determined by ESBuild. Some libraries may resolve to a name that is not in a format of `chunk.hash.mjs`. This causes Jest to run over the lib files and fail as it contains no test suite.

Fixes: #25189

## What is the new behavior?

The change sets chunk name pattern explicitly so that all `chunk`s are exluded by pattern from running tests over.

<!-- Please describe the new behavior that. -->

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

## Other information

I didn't figure out how this could be covered by tests. I did run a local build & installation and verified on a sample project that `@azure/msal-angular` no longer creates a "StandardController" file. Instead, it's named as `chunk...` and hence is excluded from tests.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): Set chunk names explicitly" (#25511)

Issues.Body: There is a separate, internal version of the Angular CLI which should be used instead. Running this version can lead to unintuitive and unexpected behavior. This commit intentionally does not include an opt-out because there is no supported use case for running the external CLI inside google3. If someone is broken by this and presents a compelling use case, we can reconsider and add an opt-out for this check.

Issues.Title: crypto issue
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

BREAKING CHANGE: webpack < 5 used to include polyfills for node.js core modules by default.
This is no longer the case. Verify if you need this module and configure a polyfill for it.

If you want to include a polyfill, you need to:
        - add a fallback 'resolve.fallback: { "crypto": require.resolve("crypto-browserify") }'
        - install 'crypto-browserify'
If you don't want to include a polyfill, you can use an empty module like this:
        resolve.fallback: { "crypto": false }

### Minimal Reproduction

while using 'ng run start' or 'ng run build' 

### Exception or Error

_No response_

Node: 14.21.0

Issues.Title: bug(Date Picker): Bug in picking Hijri Date
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using the "ar-SA" locale in Angular Material datepicker component, the date on display (illustrated in the following image) is shifted back two months and does not represent the actual date.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/87255704/e6365b81-eb49-4a72-9b6b-6131088aebe8)

Moreover, when selecting the date on the datepicker, another date appears different to that selected (indicated in image below); however, the date that appears in the text field is the correct date that matches today's date.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/87255704/5f5ac017-ddad-46e3-b2d4-6405e8042c18)



### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://components-issue-f7fmes.stackblitz.io
Steps to reproduce:
1. Select an Today's date
2. Date in text field appears correct
3. Date in Date picker appears incorrectly


### Expected Behavior

Date should match in both picker and text field

### Actual Behavior

Date in datepicker is incorrect and should be shifted

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.9
- CDK/Material:15.2.1
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Date Picker): Bug in picking Hijri Date" (#27429)

Issues.Title: docs(material/menu): require only static content and MenuItems in popup
Issues.Body:
Update a11y documentation for MatMenu. REquest that MatMenu should not contain interactive controls, aside from MatMenuItem.

Add clarification for the supported configurations of MatMenu. A common accessibility mistake is to nest interactive controls inside of a menu popup.

Issues.Title: bug(MatTabGroup): Visibility hidden mat-active-tab is not removed when MatTabGroup and MatTabs are used inside MatMenu
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

If we use MatTabGroup + MatTabs inside the MatMenu component, then in some cases the visibility hidden inline styling is not getting removed from the active tab. Refer steps or attached video for more details

https://github.com/angular/components/assets/92505353/7e512847-02ea-4d8b-9df8-f8da3cb1019a

Once the state has been reached, switching between more tabs can eventually 'fix' it, but only for that opening of the menu. Closing and reopening the menu can result in the issue reproducing again. A workaround, that is also demoed in the video, is to add custom styles, setting visibility to visible. Since the erroneous styling is applied inline, this workaround also requires the use of !important tag, which is fine for now, but not suitable as a permanent solution. 

I'm also attaching the link to a sample github project that I used in the video recording, for more info on how the code is structured. 

https://github.com/swapnil-verma-gl/angular-material-tabs

Addl note - While the project and the video use Angular Material v16, I can confirm that this issue is also present in at least angular v14, as that is what our actual project uses, and is where we first encountered this bug. 


### Reproduction

Stackblitz Link - https://stackblitz.com/edit/klkt9a-mfwvvv?file=package.json
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a component with a MatMenu and its trigger
2. Inside the MatMenu, add a MatTabGroup, with a couple of tabs
3. For each tab, add some content. This may be content directly inside the mat tab, or getting projected from another component
4. Now, open the menu and switch between some tabs
5. Close the menu
6. Repeat steps 4 and 5 repeatedly. Eventually, you will reach a state where the content for the active tab is not being shown. Refer video recording for more details

### Expected Behavior

Content for active tab is visible

### Actual Behavior

Content for active tab is hidden.

### Environment

- Angular: 14
- CDK/Material: 14
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(MatTabGroup): Visibility hidden mat-active-tab is not removed when MatTabGroup and MatTabs are used inside MatMenu" (#27426)

Issues.Title: fix(material/schematics): support all potential default builders for ng add
Issues.Body: With the advent of the developer preview for the esbuild-based browser application builder, there are now three potential "default" builders that could be present: browser, browser-esbuild, and application. To ensure that the material add schematics work with CLI generated projects moving forward, all of these potential builders are now checked when running the add schematics.

Issues.Title: fix(material/autocomplete): blocking events to other overlays when there are no results
Issues.Body:
The autocomplete trigger attaches an overlay even if there are no options in the list. It also subscribes to keydown events and clicks while the panel is open which block events from reaching other overlays. This means that if the user focuses an autocomplete input with no options, the events from it won't reach other overlays.

These changes resolve the issue by subcribing and unsubscribing from the event streams depending on the visibility state of the panel.

Fixes #26479.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/autocomplete): blocking events to other overlays when there are no results" (#27432)

Issues.Title: bug(MatFormFieldModule): Label is outside the bounds of the form field
Issues.Body:
The label associated with a MatFormField is not positioned correctly.

**Case 1 - matPrefix**
As visible in the following image, the label is outside the bounds of the form field.

![1](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25796932/62054bed-c052-41cd-89af-73feb2a8323f)

Inside `form-field.ts` - `_updateOutlineLabelOffset()` the HTML element is moved on the x-axis:
```ts
floatingLabel.style.transform = `var( --mat-mdc-form-field-label-transform, {FLOATING_LABEL_DEFAULT_DOCKED_TRANSFORM} translateX(${labelHorizontalOffset}))`;
```
> This is also visible in DevTools.
This transformation rule looks valid because it has a prefix icon. 
But in addition, if the element is moved on the x-axis, its width should be reduced by a value equal to the offset to fit the form field bounds.
```scss
width: calc(100% - calc(1 * (51.97072219848633px + var(--mat-mdc-form-field-label-offset-x, 0px))));
```
![2](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25796932/929bfe46-1c53-458f-8ece-78a12350f8bd)

**Case 2 - matSuffix**
For `matSuffix` the fix would be easier, it should only update its width with the offset value.
 
![4](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25796932/d941b793-7c2c-4b1f-b5ba-0e28ee21d49f)

**However** here it seems that the offset variable is missing from the scss file.
![var](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/25796932/75c39dac-07ff-457b-b8d6-78e52719d669)

Adding the CSS variable to the above file and updating the width should help with this issue.




### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/rudguk-yo1ggv?file=src%2Fexample%2Fform-field-appearance-example.html


### Expected Behavior

I expect the label to fit into the borders of the wrapping element.

### Actual Behavior

The label goes outside the borders of the wrapping element.

### Environment

- Angular: latest
- CDK/Material: latest
- Browser(s): Any
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Any
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatFormFieldModule): Label is outside the bounds of the form field" (#27431)

Issues.Title: bug(selection-model): setSelection in SelectionModel does not respect compareWith
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using compareWith, setSelection method may deselect comparable items.
Cause is usage of Set and has method https://github.com/angular/components/blob/7c8a796294713c6f102885c94088a9c4713ffdd4/src/cdk/collections/selection-model.ts#L94-L98
This line https://github.com/angular/components/blob/7c8a796294713c6f102885c94088a9c4713ffdd4/src/cdk/collections/selection-model.ts#L94 could be replaced by 
` const newSelectedSet = new Set(values.map(value => this._getConcreteValue(value)));`
to use compareWith
### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-jfhnli?file=src%2Fmain.ts
Steps to reproduce:
1. Instanciate a SelectionModel of object and non trivial compareWith function 
2. call setSelection method to select one object o1, selectionModel.selection should be [o1]
3. call setSelection again with a copy o2 of previous object (o2 must be comparable to o1 according compareWith, ie compareWith(o1,o2) is true)


### Expected Behavior

SelectionModel selection should be one of the selected objects, either [o1] or [o2]

### Actual Behavior

SelectionModel selection is empty

### Environment

- Angular: 16
- CDK/Material: 16
- Browser(s): no browser needed
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(selection-model): setSelection in SelectionModel does not respect compareWith" (#27425)

Issues.Title: build: add a script to detect component ID collisions
Issues.Body:
As of v16, the framework uses the metadata of a component to generate an ID. If two components have identical metadata, they may end up with the same ID which will log a warning. These changes add a script to detect such cases automatically.

Relates to https://github.com/angular/components/issues/27163.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: add a script to detect component ID collisions" (#27411)

Issues.Title: bug(DatePicker): Typing a date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format will format the date to "M/D/YYYY" but a day behind
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Typing a date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format will format the date to "M/D/YYYY" but a day behind. This occurs using the control in various modes, including the date range picker. 

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce (can use demo on documentation page):
1. Render date picker with default formatting.
2. Type in the value "2023-07-06"
3. Lose focus of the input field.
4. The date picker changes the value to: "7/5/2023"


### Expected Behavior

I expect to see the date represented in a different format with the same date value. 

Value entered: 2023-07-06 
Expected result: 7/6/2023

### Actual Behavior

The date in the proper format, but one day behind. 

Value entered: 2023-07-06 
Actual result: 7/5/2023

### Environment

This bug occurs on the demo page for angular material: 
https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/overview

- Angular: v14+
- CDK/Material: v14+ (probably earlier)
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(DatePicker): Typing a date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format will format the date to "M/D/YYYY" but a day behind" (#27412)
